issue.title: Meta's upcoming changes to Facebook Shops checkout process
issue.body:
This issue is for tracking conversations related to Meta's upcoming changes to Facebook Shops Checkout. If you're a merchant seeking additional information, please read our update [here](https://wordpress.org/support/topic/important-upcoming-changes-to-facebook-shops-checkout-process).

- [Meta's official announcement](https://web.facebook.com/business/help/623552069600842)
- [Internal notice](https://wp.me/pcTzPI-t7)
- [Internal Slack conversation](https://a8c.slack.com/archives/C02N221NSB0/p1683020994976489) 
- [Pinned forum support thread](https://wordpress.org/support/topic/important-upcoming-changes-to-facebook-shops-checkout-process/)

issue.title: [Facebook for WooCommerce] Product Sets does not sync to Commerce Manager

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

issue.body:
## 🔎 Isolate the bug
<!-- Mark completed isolation steps with an [X] -->

- [X] I have confirmed this occurs in the most recent version of WordPress, WooCommerce, and Facebook for WooCommerce.
- [X] I have confirmed this occurs when only WooCommerce and Facebook for WooCommerce are active and when using a default WordPress or WooCommerce theme.

## ✍️ Describe the bug

I could not sync my Product Sets, created on my Woo store, using Facebook for WooCommerce, to show on my Commerce Manager.

## 🚶‍♀️ Steps to reproduce

1. Added the title and description and mapped to the WC product category.
2. Added a description and Google product category to the Product Category.
3. Facebook for WooCommerce → Product Sync and manually synced.

## ✔️ Expected behavior

I expected the Product Sets to appear on Facebook Commerce Manager.

comment.body: I have tried reproducing this on a fresh setup without luck. This will require some time to investigate. I marked as needs investigation.

This is a tricky behaviour but it is known. The `isset` is not a function - it is a language construct and it works on variables only. In your case, the `$response->handles` is not a variable. `handles` is a property of the `$this->response_data` defined in the base class `JSONResponse`. You access the `handles` via the magic function `__get` from the `JSONResponse`. As it was mentioned `isset` is not able to operate on anything else than a variable and here you have a return value of a function.

Complicated for sure :) Your code is good and you can remove the comment.

pull_request.title: Product Item batch api sync
pull_request.body:
### Changes proposed in this Pull Request:
[1/2]
Currently the video syncing is only supported by [batch-api](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/reference/product-catalog/items_batch/) / feed upload

This pull requests adds the following
* Replace update product item calls with batch api call

<!--- Optional --->

### flows are affected
* Move updating/saving a single product to batch api (This IMO is the major change here, as it changes an existing functionality completely)
   * ***Note*** - Creating a simple product is still being synced through [Product-Item POST](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/reference/product-item/) api. This can be looked in a further pull request.

### Tests
* Integration tests are updated and CI passing in forked repo - https://github.com/rahulraina7/facebook-for-woocommerce/actions/runs/6556265345
* **E2E Tests**
   - Single Product Update
       * Go to individual product.
       * Click Publish->Update
       * Outcome : Item synced to facebook

comment.body:
Hello @budzanowski @rawdreeg  - I have implemented creating products using batch api.

There's only one difference since batch API is a async API. We don't receive product-item-ids immediately after API call, and thus they are not cached  immediately using 

```
update_post_meta(
  $woo_product->get_id(),
  self::FB_PRODUCT_ITEM_ID,
  $fb_product_item_id
);			
```

That's called using the old create product API. I have also udpated the tests and description.

comment.body: @rawdreeg could you see if you can replicate the issue on a fresh setup? i.e., new site and new Facebook for WooCommerce connection. Dani and I narrowed it down to new FB connections.

issue.title: [Facebook for WooCommerce] Product Sets does not sync to Commerce Manager

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

issue.body:
## 🔎 Isolate the bug
<!-- Mark completed isolation steps with an [X] -->

- [X] I have confirmed this occurs in the most recent version of WordPress, WooCommerce, and Facebook for WooCommerce.
- [X] I have confirmed this occurs when only WooCommerce and Facebook for WooCommerce are active and when using a default WordPress or WooCommerce theme.

## ✍️ Describe the bug

I could not sync my Product Sets, created on my Woo store, using Facebook for WooCommerce, to show on my Commerce Manager.

## 🚶‍♀️ Steps to reproduce

1. Added the title and description and mapped to the WC product category.
2. Added a description and Google product category to the Product Category.
3. Facebook for WooCommerce → Product Sync and manually synced.

## ✔️ Expected behavior

I expected the Product Sets to appear on Facebook Commerce Manager.

issue.title: [Facebook for WooCommerce] Product Sets does not sync to Commerce Manager
issue.body:
## 🔎 Isolate the bug
<!-- Mark completed isolation steps with an [X] -->

- [X] I have confirmed this occurs in the most recent version of WordPress, WooCommerce, and Facebook for WooCommerce.
- [X] I have confirmed this occurs when only WooCommerce and Facebook for WooCommerce are active and when using a default WordPress or WooCommerce theme.

## ✍️ Describe the bug

I could not sync my Product Sets, created on my Woo store, using Facebook for WooCommerce, to show on my Commerce Manager.

## 🚶‍♀️ Steps to reproduce

1. Added the title and description and mapped to the WC product category.
2. Added a description and Google product category to the Product Category.
3. Facebook for WooCommerce → Product Sync and manually synced.

## ✔️ Expected behavior

I expected the Product Sets to appear on Facebook Commerce Manager.

issue.title: Product Item batch api sync
issue.body:
### Changes proposed in this Pull Request:
[1/2]
Currently the video syncing is only supported by [batch-api](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/reference/product-catalog/items_batch/) / feed upload

This pull requests adds the following
* Replace update product item calls with batch api call

<!--- Optional --->

### flows are affected
* Move updating/saving a single product to batch api (This IMO is the major change here, as it changes an existing functionality completely)
   * ***Note*** - Creating a simple product is still being synced through [Product-Item POST](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/reference/product-item/) api. This can be looked in a further pull request.

### Tests
* Integration tests are updated and CI passing in forked repo - https://github.com/rahulraina7/facebook-for-woocommerce/actions/runs/6556265345
* **E2E Tests**
   - Single Product Update
       * Go to individual product.
       * Click Publish->Update
       * Outcome : Item synced to facebook

comment.body:
> > Note - Creating a simple product is still being synced through [Product-Item POST](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/reference/product-item/) API. This can be looked at in a further pull request.
> 
> I agree with @budzanowski. I want to understand: is there any reason why this is excluded from this PR?

I will take a stab at implementing this, honestly not a solid reason apart from it seemed a little less straight forward. Also I just assume that people do regular updates to products, so we will get the syncs eventually.

pull_request.title: Support Video sync in catalogs
pull_request.body:
### Changes proposed in this Pull Request:

Along with syncing images, I would also like to sync videos to the facebook catalog.
Although woo-commerce natively doesn't support product videos, but you can insert/attach a product video in the description.


Currently the video syncing is only supported by [batch-api](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/reference/product-catalog/items_batch/) / feed upload

This pull requests adds the following
* Extracts video links from product description (no native support for video / video-gallerys)
* Replace update product item calls with batch api call

<!--- Optional --->

### 2 sets of flows are affected
* Existing batch API flow, just adding a video field in the requests objects. 
* Move updating/saving a single product to batch api (This IMO is the major change here, as it changes an existing functionality completely)
   * ***Note*** - Creating a simple product is still being synced through [Product-Item POST](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/reference/product-item/) api. This can be looked in a further pull request.

### Tests
* Integration tests are updated and CI passing in forked repo - https://github.com/rahulraina7/facebook-for-woocommerce/actions/runs/6556265345
* **E2E Tests**
   - Single Product Update
       * Go to individual product. Upload a video in description
       * Click Publish->Update
       * Outcome : Video Synced to facebook
   - Batch API Update
      * Disconnect from facebook
      * Connect back and create a new catalog
      * Products are synced with batch API flow
      * Outcomes : New catalog created on facebook, with Videos synced at product level

issue.title: Enabling Messenger chat trigger errors

labels.name: priority: high
labels.description: The issue/PR is high priority—it affects lots of customers substantially, but not critically.

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: The issue is a confirmed bug.

issue.body:
## ✍️ Describe the bug

Enabling the messenger chat button triggers several errors in the console:

![kTARsa.png](https://github.com/woocommerce/facebook-for-woocommerce/assets/60121732/551d40f7-bef7-41bc-9082-25a3ea5d027c)


`Access to XMLHttpRequest at 'https://web.facebook.com/plugins/customer_chat/SDK/?app_id=&attribution=fbe_woocommerce&channel=https%3A%2F%2Fstaticxx.facebook.com%2Fx%2Fconnect%2Fxd_arbiter%2F%3Fversion%3D46%23cb%3Df2d1f3cb6736c4%26domain%3Ditsanothertestsite.mystagingwebsite.com%26is_canvas%3Dfalse%26origin%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fitsanothertestsite.mystagingwebsite.com%252Ff20bca75db2a22c%26relation%3Dparent.parent&current_url=https%3A%2F%2Fitsanothertestsite.mystagingwebsite.com%2F&event_name=chat_plugin_sdk_facade_create&is_loaded_by_facade=true&loading_time=0&locale=en_US&log_id=478eec60-bcae-46f2-a069-2bf63aa38c60&page_id=102798312634091&request_time=1692687350867&sdk=joey&should_use_new_domain=false&suppress_http_code=1' from origin 'https://itsanothertestsite.mystagingwebsite.com' has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource.
xfbml.customerchat.js:117     GET https://web.facebook.com/plugins/customer_chat/SDK/?app_id=&attribution=fbe_woocommerce&channel=https%3A%2F%2Fstaticxx.facebook.com%2Fx%2Fconnect%2Fxd_arbiter%2F%3Fversion%3D46%23cb%3Df2d1f3cb6736c4%26domain%3Ditsanothertestsite.mystagingwebsite.com%26is_canvas%3Dfalse%26origin%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fitsanothertestsite.mystagingwebsite.com%252Ff20bca75db2a22c%26relation%3Dparent.parent&current_url=https%3A%2F%2Fitsanothertestsite.mystagingwebsite.com%2F&event_name=chat_plugin_sdk_facade_create&is_loaded_by_facade=true&loading_time=0&locale=en_US&log_id=478eec60-bcae-46f2-a069-2bf63aa38c60&page_id=102798312634091&request_time=1692687350867&sdk=joey&should_use_new_domain=false&suppress_http_code=1 net::ERR_FAILED 400`


## 🚶‍♀️ Steps to reproduce

1. Go to Marketing > Facebook > Messenger and Enable Messenger	
2. Check the browser console and notice several errors
3. Disable messenger chat and notice all errors disappear

## ✔️ Expected behavior

Enabling messenger chat shouldn't trigger these errors. 

## Affected users

https://wordpress.org/support/topic/errors-307/ (led to [this review](https://wordpress.org/support/topic/bad-plugin-157/))

comment.body: Hey @MarvinXu, I actually see the same errors on that site: However, the Messenger chat still works. From testing, it looks like we're having the same issue with this extension, so it would appear to be something that has to be resolved on Meta's server side. Un/fortunately, it's not an issue that breaks functionality, so it probably won't be particularly high priority :/

comment.body: Hi Marvin, beyond the above message board, we don't have much more information. What plugin are you using on your old site? Does it work on a new site, too? Maybe we can confirm that it works and try to figure out why.
